text: Evergreen is a small town in Avoyelles Parish, Louisiana, United States. ==History== First named "Bayou Ridge", the town's name was later changed to "Evergreen", inspired by its beautiful, evergreen magnolia trees. The first store in Evergreen was owned by Alanson Pearce and was located on the Barbreck plantation that had been established by his wife's grandfather Marsden Campbell. The town was chartered in 1869. ==Geography== Evergreen is located at (30.952856, -92.109068). According to the United States Census Bureau, the town has a total area of , all land. ==References== Category:Towns in Avoyelles Parish, Louisiana
title: Evergreen, Louisiana
